pages.text: The opal shell are the $(1)peaceful$() grazers of the $(d)jeweled forest$() biome, found in small groups throughout the forest. These large tortoises have been observed with have opal growths on their shells. Shearing these causes them no harm, therefore doing so is encouraged. It has been noted that sometimes the shearing has resulted in a rare, deep purple opal varient to drop. They love apples
